title: South Africa: Cosatu North West Condemns Attacks On Workers' Rights By Former Ccma Commissioners Used As Consultants By Bosses
text:
Zimbabwe: Nyari Mashayamombe - Singer, Girl Child Activist 
Whilst workers strike for better wages, to dismiss them after a settlement defeats the purpose of a strike. 
COSATU North West has observed same ultra vires motives utilized in the mining sector, with same experience noted at Impala mine. 
COSATU North West is perturbed by improper relations between serving Commissioners and bosses in dictating outcomes of disputes. 
Some of the Commissioners dismissed are employed as labour consultants by municipalities. 
COSATU North West rejects the willy nilly dismissal of workers at Ngaka Modire Molema municipality. 
We want to warn these commissioners that workers will never leave such improper practices unchallenged! 
We call on the CCMA to investigate the allegations on collusion by some commissioners and take action against those that are doing these unsound things in the name of CCMA or using CCMA to make money. 
We call on our unions and all our shop stewards to expose commissioners colluding with bosses against workers. 
We call SAMWU shop stewards in Ngaka Modire Molema to demand the dismissal of the former CCMA commissioner, who was dismissed as commissioner by CCMA and now appointed labour consulted to dismiss workers. 
We call employers not to use former CCMA commissioners against workers. 
Municipalities have employed legal personnel to execute functions in all workplaces and must discontinue leasing consultants and thus spending unwisely funds to be channelled for service delivery. 
COSATU North West calls for intervention of the provincial government on the usage of consultants in municipalities. 
COSATU North West calls for urgent discontinued contracts with commissioners hell-bent to dismiss workers. 
We will name and shame these commissioners very soon publicly and we will not be intimidated and threatened by anyone. South Africa
